bdi4jade.core

Class Capability

  • java.lang.Object
    • bdi4jade.core.Capability
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UtilityBasedCabability

    public class Capability
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This capability represents a component that aggregates the mental attitudes defined by the BDI architecture. It has a belief base with the associated beliefs (knowledge) and a plan library.
    Author:
    Ingrid Nunes
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Capability

        public Capability()
        Creates a new capability with a generated id. It uses BeliefBase and PlanLibrary as belief base and plan library respectively.

      • Capability

        public Capability(java.util.Set<Belief<?,?>> initialBeliefs,
                  java.util.Set<Plan> initialPlans)
        Creates a new capability with a generated id. It uses BeliefBase and PlanLibrary as belief base and plan library respectively, and adds initial beliefs and plans.
        Parameters:
        initialBeliefs - the initial set of beliefs to be added to the belief base of this capability.
        initialPlans - the initial set of plans to be added to the plan library of this capability.

      • Capability

        public Capability(java.lang.String id)
        Creates a new capability with the given id. It uses BeliefBase and PlanLibrary as belief base and plan library respectively.
        Parameters:
        id - the capability id. If it is null, the class name is going to be used.

      • Capability

        protected Capability(java.lang.String id,
                     BeliefBase beliefBase,
                     java.util.Set<Belief<?,?>> initialBeliefs,
                     PlanLibrary planLibrary,
                     java.util.Set<Plan> initialPlans)
        Creates a new capability with the given id, or a generated one if it is null. It also sets the belief base and plan library, and adds initial beliefs and plans.
        Parameters:
        id - the capability id. If it is null, the class name is going to be used.
        beliefBase - the belief base.
        initialBeliefs - the initial set of beliefs to be added to the belief base of this capability.
        planLibrary - the plan library.
        initialPlans - the initial set of plans to be added to the plan library of this capability.

      • Capability

        public Capability(java.lang.String id,
                  java.util.Set<Belief<?,?>> initialBeliefs,
                  java.util.Set<Plan> initialPlans)
        Creates a new capability with the given id. It uses BeliefBase and PlanLibrary as belief base and plan library respectively, and adds initial beliefs and plans.
        Parameters:
        id - the capability id. If it is null, the class name is going to be used.
        initialBeliefs - the initial set of beliefs to be added to the belief base of this capability.
        initialPlans - the initial set of plans to be added to the plan library of this capability.

    • Method Detail

      • addAnnotatedFields

        protected void addAnnotatedFields(java.lang.Class<? extends Capability> capabilityClass)
        Adds by reflection capability components, such as beliefs and plans, according to annotated fields. This method is invoked by for capability class, and all parent classes.
        Parameters:
        capabilityClass - the capability class of which fields should me added to this capability.

      • addAssociatedCapability

        public final void addAssociatedCapability(Capability capability)
        Associates a capability to this capability.
        Parameters:
        capability - the capability to be associated.

      • addCandidatePlans

        public void addCandidatePlans(Goal goal,
                              java.util.Map<Capability,java.util.Set<Plan>> candidatePlansMap)
        Adds the set of plans of this capability that can achieve the given goal to a map of candidate plans. It checks its plan library and the part capabilities, recursively.
        Parameters:
        goal - the goal to be achieved.
        candidatePlansMap - the map to which the set of plans that can achieve the goal should be added.

      • addPartCapability

        public final void addPartCapability(Capability partCapability)
        Adds a capability as part of this capability, which is a whole-capability.
        Parameters:
        partCapability - the part capability to be added.

      • canAchieve

        public boolean canAchieve(Goal goal)
        Checks if this capability has a plan that can achieve the given goal. It checks the plan library of this capabilities and, if cannot achieve it, it checks part capabilities, recursively.
        Parameters:
        goal - the goal to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if this capability has at least a plan that can achieve the goal.

      • canHandle

        public boolean canHandle(jade.lang.acl.ACLMessage msg)
        Checks if this capability has a plan that can process the given message. It checks the plan library of this capabilities and, if cannot handle it, it checks part capabilities, recursively.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if this capability has at least a plan that can process the message.

      • getGoalOwner

        public final java.util.Set<Capability> getGoalOwner(java.lang.Class<? extends Capability> owner,
                                                    boolean internal)
        Returns the capability instances that owns a dispatched goal, considering the superclasses of this capability, its associations and compositions. A capability may dispatch its own goals and goals of its parents. It may also dispatch external goals of associated or part capabilities (and their parents), and all goals of whole capabilities. This method thus searches all capabilities that have a relationship with this capability (either inheritance, composition or association) and finds the concrete capability instances whose definition owns a goal (specified with the Owner annotation in goals). If this method returns an empty set, it means that this capability has no access to the goal owned by capabilities of the given class.
        Parameters:
        owner - the capability class that is the goal owner.
        internal - the boolean that indicates whether the goal is internal or external.
        Returns:
        the capability instances related to this capability (or the capability itself) that owns the goal, or an empty set if the capability has no access to goals owned by capability of the given class.

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Returns this capability id.

        the id.

      • setup

        protected void setup()
        This is an empty holder for being overridden by subclasses. It is used to initialize the capability. This method is invoked when this capability is attached to an agent for the first time. It may be used to add initial plans and beliefs. The reasoning strategies of this capability are initialized in the constructor with default strategies. This method may also customize them.

      • takeDown

        protected void takeDown()
        This is an empty holder for being overridden by subclasses. It is used to clean up a capability when it is removed from an agent.
